job description:
Senior Business Data Analyst
Wilmington, DE

Function:
Coordinates components of the data program within an assigned area of the Bank, carrying out the execution of governance, quality, issue management, reporting, data architecture, solutions, analytics, or project management activities with some oversight from management and the overall Enterprise Data Management Program.
This role will support all aspects of the RMO. Including intern, TDP, mentoring and headcount data models, collection and analytics.
  • Develop centralized dashboards and scorecards for the core services provided within RMO
  • Headcount management
  • Contractor/Vendor management
  • Interns
  • Mentor Program
  • Campus Recruiting
  • Experience Hires - Talent Management
  • TDP Program (performance metrics and business process analysis)
  • Assist with coordination of campus recruiting activities, intern even coordination and mentor program activities.
  • Interface with management, peers and external partners to understand, interpret and identify the best data collection and reporting models.
    • Competencies:
  • Influencing
  • Strong written and verbal communication
  • Presentation Skills
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
  • Creative Thinking
  • Collaboration & Teamwork
    • Technical Skills:
  • Advanced Excel skills
  • Access or SQL database knowledge
  • MS Office - PowerPoint, MS Publisher
  • Tableau or similar
    • Responsibilities:
    Work with business and Technology personnel within assigned units to implement the Data Management Program within assigned area of the Bank.
    Develop an understanding of data management practices.
    Assist in developing metrics to measure compliance with the business and Enterprise Data Management policy and standards for assigned units.
    Work with assigned units to document metadata for identified critical data elements.
    Assist in monitoring the quality of data within assigned units and facilitate disposition of data quality exceptions.
    Work with assigned units to conduct root cause analysis and document remediation plans for data management-related issues.
    Leverage business and enterprise data management and business intelligence tools to assist assigned units in effectively managing their data.
    Assist assigned units in completing data analysis to derive insights that may result in tangible business value.
    Understand and adhere to the Company's risk and regulatory standards, policies and controls in accordance with the Company's Risk Appetite. Identify risk-related issues needing escalation to management.
    Promote an environment that supports diversity and reflects the M & T Bank brand.
    Maintain M & T internal control standards, including timely implementation of internal and external audit points together with any issues raised by external regulators as applicable.
    Complete other related duties as assigned.

    Nature & Scope:

    Required Qualifications:
    Bachelor's degree and a minimum of 2 years' professional experience, or in lieu of a degree, a combined minimum of 6 years' higher education and/or work experience, including a minimum of 2 years' professional experience
    Excellent verbal and written communication skills
    Demonstrated analytical ability
    Creative problem solving skills
    Basic project management skills
    Proficiency in the use of spreadsheets, graphing, and presentations with a working knowledge of financial models

    Preferred Qualifications:
    Banking or data management industry experience
    Working knowledge of Data Management principles and/or Bank products, systems and workflows
    Working knowledge of process improvement methodology and business process management techniques
    Proficient in pertinent project and presentation software
